file_content.text: You'll have to excuse me. I'm always here on business. Good to see you.
You saved a lot of lives today. Senator Kayl can't wait to congratulate you.
You understand what we're up against. I hope you can help us.
You'll find Minister Imogh at the Senate tower. Tell him the Senator is expecting your arrival.
I was hoping to meet just one of you. This must be what the saying "an embarrassment of riches" means.
Considering your recent accomplishments, I shouldn't be surprised to find you traveling together. Greatness attracts greatness.
I can't speak for my friends, but I'm just another Jedi here on business.
Jedi are above flattery.
Don't be so humble. You stopped an attack on Tython's Jedi Temple--as a Padawan. People in high places are talking.
Clearly, our reputations precede us. My questions are, how... and why do you care?
What is your interest in us?
Stopping a threat like Nalen Raloch attracts attention. Your names are known in the right circles.
I don't know what you're talking about. Even if I did, I couldn't discuss it with a civilian.
My missions are classified.
Not trying to violate your security clearance, Lieutenant. I'll just thank you for exposing the traitors on Ord Mantell.
Didn't realize my exploits were public knowledge. You looking for an autograph?
Wow, I'm already famous.
Not exactly, but I am a fan. You stormed a separatist base on Ord Mantell and came back without a scratch. Impressive.
Do we know you?
You're pretty great yourself.
[Flirt] I agree.
I'm just a humble civil servant--who knows all the best restaurants.
Greatness also attracts annoying people who want things.
And unwelcome attention.
Sad, but true. Rest assured, I'm not here to waste your time.
Ah, you're here. It's a great pleasure to meet one of the Republic's finest.
You earned quite a reputation on Tython. Personally ending a threat to the Jedi Temple... inspiring.
Any Jedi could have done it. I was in the wrong place at the wrong time.
It was nothing.
Isn't that how heroes are made?
I don't know how much you heard, but there's more to it than the official story. I could tell you....
[Flirt] You're too kind.
I'd like that, but I'm afraid we'll have to wait.
I read the report about your handling of Nalen Raloch on Tython. Extraordinary work for a young Jedi.
Youth is a matter of perspective. Jedi are trained from an early age to do what they think they cannot.
Age is only a number.
As I said: extraordinary.
You flatter me, sir. Please continue.
[Flirt] That's kind of you.
If only I weren't here on business....
I realize you can't discuss it, Lieutenant--but thank you for exposing the traitors on Ord Mantell.
If you know about that, you also know I've got unfinished business.
I'm not done with them.
I'm not here to keep you from that.
You're right, I can't reveal the details--but you have permission to speak freely.
[Flirt] Keep talking.
I look forward to exercising that privilege.
I admire anyone who charges into an active volcano full of separatists and comes back alive.
Technically, I didn't know it was active when I blasted in there. Not that it mattered.
I am pretty amazing.
My point is, you have a talent for beating the odds. People respect that.
You seem to know plenty about me. What's your specialty, handsome?
[Flirt] Talk about yourself.
My function varies. Right now, I'm talking to you. Later... who knows?
Your recent heroic exploits have attracted a great deal of attention from people in high places.
I'm not a hero.
Brave and humble. Holojournalists love that. Keep it up.
Should I know you?
Where are my manners? Forgive me. Anitol Rosspar, Coruscant Special Affairs Liaison.
[Flirt] You need my help?
I'm sure we could help each other in many ways, but I'm not here for myself.
You know a lot about me.
People in the know stay that way by employing people like me.
I represent Vanara Kayl, Senator of Coruscant. She not only speaks for our capital world in the Galactic Senate, but oversees this planet's government.
Senator Kayl leads the effort to rebuild what was destroyed during the Sith Empire's invasion. Healing those old wounds has been slow and painful.
The war's been over a long time. It's hard to believe we're still recovering.
The Sith left here years ago.
Some wounds run deeper than others.
You're here collecting credits for the reconstruction, is that it?
Are you requesting donations?
A person of your skills can provide more substantial aid.
Just like this conversation.
This world faces many crises: a shattered infrastructure, a booming refugee population... whole sectors descending into anarchy. All of these hinder the rebuilding.
Senator Kayl believes you're specially qualified to deal with a dangerous and urgent threat. She'd appreciate the favor of a meeting--immediately.
The Senator needs to clear this with Master Orgus Din. If he agrees, I'll meet her.
My Master is waiting.
There's no time for standard diplomatic channels. Senator Kayl will explain everything.
A great Jedi has fallen ill. She is my priority.
My Master needs help.
Keep an open mind. What's good for Senator Kayl is good for Master Yuon as well.
I'm here on urgent business. I don't have time for political games.
Just tell me the problem.
This is no game, Lieutenant--but I'm not authorized to reveal more. You understand.
Senator, huh? My time isn't cheap.
I'm open to negotiation.
Arrangements will be made to ensure you feel properly compensated.
How long have you loitered around the spaceport waiting for my shuttle?
You've been waiting for me?
My time is the Senator's time--and I never wait for long.
I don't have time to meet with politicians.
Tell your boss I said "no."
You misunderstand. This matter is urgent. Lives are at stake.
Senator Kayl is the greatest leader we've had in decades. She'll not only rebuild this world, but the rest of the Republic with it.
Speak to Minister Imogh at the Senate tower. Tell him you're expected. Good luck--and welcome to Coruscant.
Excuse me. I'm waiting for someone.
